title: rclone sync a file bigger than 5GB to Amazon S3 throws "Failed to read set modification time: InvalidRequest: The specified copy source is larger than the maximum allowable size for a copy source" error
body:
**Issue?**
I'm using rclone to sync file against Amazon S3. When it sync a file bigger than 5GB, it will throws the error " Failed to read set modification time: InvalidRequest: The specified copy source is larger than the maximum allowable size for a copy source: 5368709120". However, the file gets uploaded to Amazon S3 but the "rcloen sync" command keep throw the error and I'm unable to write a script to wrap rclone properly as it return status is "1".

**What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)**
rclone v1.30

**Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)**
Oracle Linux Server release 6.7, 64-bit

**Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)**
Amazon S3

**The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)**
rclone sync --retries 1 -v "/a/local/folder/on/my/local/host/A-7GB-file.zip" "s3-ap-southeast-1:my-s3-bucket-name/a/remote/folder/"

**A log from the command with the `-v` flag (eg output from `rclone -v copy /tmp remote:tmp`)**

[root@my-server-name scripts]# rclone sync --retries 1 -v "/a/local/folder/on/my/local/host/A-7GB-file.zip" "s3-ap-southeast-1:my-s3-bucket-name/a/remote/folder/" ; echo "Status:$?"
